intro.description: Welcome to the tutorial for creating a Model in Whole. It will help you build a simple Model and try it out. You will create a Whole project, and a Whole Model for a simple domain. Let's get started!

item.title: Open the Java Perspective
item.description: Select Window->Open Perspective->Java in the menubar at the top of the workbench. This step changes the perspective to set up the Eclipse workbench for Java development. You can click the "Click to Perform" button to have the "Java" perspective opened automatically.

item.title: Creating a Whole Project
item.description: The first thing you will need is a Whole Project. If you already have a Whole project in your workspace that you would like to use, you may skip this step by clicking the "Click to Skip" button. If not, select File->New->Project... and choose Whole->Whole Project in the list. Complete the subsequent pages as required. The "New Whole Project" wizard is automatically displayed when you click the "Click to Perform" button.

item.title: Create your simple model
item.description: You should now have a Whole Project in your workspace. The next step in building your model is to create your HelloWorld model. You may do this by either clicking the "Click to Perform" button below to launch the New Java Class wizard, or you may use the Eclipse tools to do it, by using the File->New->Whole Model action. When you use the wizard, make sure that you specify the Language of your choice.
